content: february 2013 2 magic with hook and needles w ww vendulkam blogspot com note 100% cotton camilla by madame tricote paris could also be used … it has the same wonderful bright colors and is a very similar yarn other materials four buttons about 1/2 inch 1 5cm in diameter 3/4 inch 2cm maximum i used dress it up buttons some beads note as the title says this is a revised version of my original pattern version february 2013 i am really sorry i confused you last time i spent many time again to write new version so i hope that this time it will be clear now all if you find something confusing please write me on this e-mail vendula maderska@seznam cz dear girls i am very happy you like my design but please noticed that this pattern is not to teaching you to crocheting pattern you should know basic skills this cardigan is not difficult to make the hardest part is probably the yoke … you need to keep counting the stitches on every round to be sure the increases line up properly working from the neck edge down the chart below gives instructions for the yoke after row 24 separate the yoke into two fronts the back and two sleeves please read all notes carefully before starting to avoid having to rework note 1 i have made this cardigan in various color combinations i decided leave only two 3 note 2 the yoke is worked in a 2-round pattern … 1 row of double_crochet followed by 1 row of single_crochet count the number of stitches while working every round to avoid having to rework rounds note 3 very important begin every round of double_crochet with 3 chain then make a half_double_crochet in the very first stitch this beginning 3 chain 1 half_double_crochet group counts as the 1st double_crochet see picture below begin every round of single_crochet with 1 chain then make the first single_crochet in the first stitch this beginning 1 chain 1 single_crochet group counts as the 1st single_crochet note 4 at the end of every round turn your work and start the next round as given in note 2 working round ends this way gives nice straight edges © vendula maderska 2013 the patterns are intended for personal use only that means none commercial purposes all rights
